main.name: Jingwen Li
main.description: This is my personal website. Scroll down or click the banner above to read my bio, check out my projects, or download my resume.
main.bio: I have always been passionate about empowering others to reach their full potential, no matter whether it is through rehab with patients, or using technology to transform our digital life. I had 9 years of first-hand clinical and managerial experience working as a lead occupational therapist and later as the project/program manager of a cross-functional team. While working full-time, I also graduated as one of the top students in my MBA program. After discovering my passion for software engineering over the past a couple of years, I began teaching myself different programming languages (Python, Java, Javascript, HTML, CSS) and eventually completed a rigorous 14-week, 3-stack software development bootcamp with the highest honor in class. Now, I am ready to leverage my diverse skill sets and experiences in not only tech, but also healthcare and business, to build something truly meaningful and impactful at a societal level.

education.description: A rigorous 14-week, 3-stack software development bootcamp, covering the full life-cycle of software development.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Occupational Therapy

work.title: Project/Program Manager (Director Of Rehabilitation)
work.description: At ONR, I led a cross-functional team of 8-10 therapists to provide patient-centered care to 500+ senior residents, and produced significantly higher customer satisfaction rate by reducing monthly complaints by 75%. I also launched two initiatives at the facility level which decreased staff injury rate by 10%, increased department productivity by 15% via better time management, coordination, and team building, and delivered quarterly facility-wide presentations on service innovations to key stakeholders, including the CEO and other C-suite directors.

work.title: Project Manager/Lead Occupational Therapist
work.description: At Kindred, I managed a team of therapists/rehab aides in offering client-centered occupational therapy to medically complex patients requiring intensive level of care, and frequently represented the department in communicating with the C-suite and interdisciplinary care teams to deliver the best values to clients. I was also able to manage multiple programs simultaneously, including but not limited to, recruiting, new staff training, program designing and implementation, and evaluation. As recognition, I was selected as one of the 30 candidates out of 10000+ employees on the west coast to attend pre-management training courses and represented the entire facility to attend the company-wide annual conference.
